summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence between prosecutors and defense attorneys regarding the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. The emails primarily discuss scheduling meetings and calls, coordinating witness testimony from JPMorgan, and logistical details for the trial, including jury selection.

persons.name: Allison Stoddart
persons.context: Attorney from WilmerHale representing or involved in the defense side of the Ghislaine Maxwell case, coordinating meetings and witness matters with the prosecution.

persons.name: Alison
persons.context: Prosecutor from the Southern District of New York handling the Ghislaine Maxwell case, corresponding with defense counsel about scheduling and trial preparation.

persons.name: Anjan Sahni
persons.context: Attorney from WilmerHale copied on the correspondence, part of the defense legal team.

persons.name: Pat McHugh
persons.context: Referred to as 'Pat', a person with whom both legal teams need to schedule a call; likely a witness or consultant involved in the case.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: Mentioned in one email as a recipient alongside Alison and Lara; likely another prosecutor or legal staff member.

persons.name: Lara
persons.context: Mentioned in one email as a recipient alongside Alison and Maurene; likely another prosecutor or legal staff member.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell

connections.description: Prosecutor and defense attorney corresponding professionally about scheduling and trial logistics in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
Both are attorneys at WilmerHale and are copied on the same emails regarding the Maxwell case.
Stoddart is arranging calls between the legal teams and Pat McHugh, indicating a professional relationship.

events.title: Jury Selection and Trial Scheduling
events.description: The emails reference ongoing jury selection for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial, creating scheduling difficulties for meetings between legal teams.

events.title: Request for JPMorgan Trial Subpoena
events.description: Defense attorney Allison Stoddart requests a trial appearance subpoena for a witness from JPMorgan, indicating the bank's involvement in the case.

events.title: Weekend Scheduling Follow-up
events.description: Emails exchanged over a weekend to schedule a call to follow up on a previous meeting, showing the intense preparation schedule.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
7 World Trade Center, 250 Greenwich Street, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The correspondence shows active trial preparation for United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell in November 2021, during the jury selection phase.
JPMorgan Chase is involved in the case, with the defense working to identify a trial witness from the bank and requesting a subpoena for their appearance.
A person named Pat McHugh is a focal point for scheduling calls between the prosecution and defense teams, suggesting he is a significant witness or consultant.
The emails reveal the logistical challenges and after-hours work required by both legal teams during the high-profile trial.
